New Records: It was Australia's second-highest successful chase in T20I cricket.
Key Match Events: Cameron Green blitzed a 26-ball half-century in his first innings as an opener in professional cricket.
Matthew Wade provided the finishing kick as Australia hunted down 209 on a flat pitch in Mohali.
Axar Patel applied the brakes on Australia with figures of 3 for 17 in his four overs.
Hardik Pandya struck a rapid 30-ball 71 not out.
Nathan Ellis returned 3 for 30 in his four overs, including the key wickets of Kohli and Dinesh Karthik.
Green's dismissal triggered a wobble as Australia lost three wickets for 14 runs in 12 balls.
Wade alone hit 45 off 29 balls, to expose India's death bowling.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The placid track, a lighting-quick outfield and incredible ball-striking formed the ingredients of a Hardik special.
India's lax fielding and death bowling were highlighted as areas of concern.
